title: Drawing, "Design for a Chair", 1790
medium: Brush and watercolor, pen and black ink, grey wash over white laid paper. Ruled borders in black ink.
inscribed:
Lower right, "N" (encircled), in black ink. See note below.
Note: In the Lugt supplement, 1953 b, "N" (encircled) probably originates from the time of the French Revolution. Usually in black ink on verso but in this case mark appears on recto.
provenance: From the Collection of Léon Decloux
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Side chair, elongated seat upholstered in purple, bordered with leaf motif on pink and white stripe.  Fan-shaped back, rectangular panel with central rosette upholstered back rest.

exhibitions.title: The Cooper-Hewitt Collections: A Design Resource
